item.description:
NPR's Mara Liasson will be giving a talk in the Darrell West Lecture Series at the Congregational Church on Angell street this Saturday night.

The topic is "Race, Religion and Gender in the 2008 Election".

I attended a previous event in this series last spring that discussed the intersection of religious/moral belief and the American political process. It was an interesting talk. No particular religious belief needed to be held to enjoy and learn something from that lecture, I expect this one will be the same.


After the lecture lets plan to go to one of the many coffee houses on nearby Thayer Street and discuss our reactions.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of the Church at 5:45
item.name: Mara Liasson speaks on "Race, Religion and Gender in the 2008 Election"
